p: When performing hierarchical clustering of the 717 DEGs between FOXL2 C134W and FOXL2 WT in all 5 conditions (Fig.Â 1d), we observed different patterns of expression with respect to the control, with the most common pattern being genes upregulated in FOXL2 C134W with respect to FOXL2 WT and to the control, but not upregulated in FOXL2 WT respect to the controls. This suggests that a majority of the expression changes involved genes that were not canonical targets of FOXL2 wild type, but became target of gain-of-function FOXL2 C134W, in line with a previous study by Weis-Banke et al. [ 37]. On the other hand, samples that overexpressed FOXO1 in addition to FOXL2 C134W or FOXL2 WT clustered closer to the controls than their counterpart without FOXO1, suggesting that FOXO1 attenuated the effects of overexpressing FOXL2 C134W or FOXL2 WT. These two observations will be further investigated in the following analyses.
